app.tip-notification: Tip: you can navigate pages with arrow keys!

home.title: Welcome to my Portfolio
home.subtitle: Systems hacker, toolmaker & web minimalist.
home.intro:
Hi, I'm a 1st-year Computer Science student in the "BUT Informatique" program in Clermont-Ferrand (France).
I love coding, tinkering with my OS, and creating efficient solutions to problems.
Besides tech I try to learn piano and sometimes draw.
Welcome to my portfolio!

4.title: BUT Informatique
4.content: 1st-year student exploring the world of computer science and software development.
4.details: This year I have been learning to develop and optimize applications, manage complex networked IT systems, work with information and data, as well as to lead a project and collaborate within an IT team. In my free time, I have also been learning about exciting technologies like Rust and Nix.

3.title: High School Diploma
3.content: Graduated with a specialization in computers (SIN).
3.details: These 3 years of highschool have allowed me build my future by making me explore both IT and construction technologies, while learning about environmental sustainability.

2.title: Internship - Tech Support and Servers
2.content: Learned about collaboration in a professional environment.
2.details: This internship was an amazing opportunity for me to discover the professional environment. I gained insight on how a technical support team works at the national head office of a country-scale company.

1.title: Self-Taught Programming
1.content: Began exploring programming with small projects, setting the foundation for future learning.
1.details: I got into programming while using social media: I made a Discord bot as my first project, using Javascript. I then continued learning with web development. The pandemic was an opportunity for me to discover this passion.

command-line.title: Command Line
command-line.description:
Here, you can navigate through the content of all the pages using Unix commands.
Use ls to list available files, then cat [filename] to read a file.
You can also see all the available commands with help.
